user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of parse_bauth_params:
```c
static bool
parse_bauth_params (const char *str,
                    size_t str_len,
                    struct MHD_RqBAuth *pbauth)
{
  size_t i;

  i = 0;

  /* Skip all whitespaces at start */
  while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
    i++;

  if (str_len > i)
  {
    size_t token68_start;
    size_t token68_len;

    /* 'i' points to the first non-whitespace char after scheme token */
    token68_start = i;
    /* Find end of the token. Token cannot contain whitespace. */
    while (i < str_len && ' ' != str[i] && '\t' != str[i])
    {
      if (0 == str[i])
        return false;  /* Binary zero is not allowed */
      if ((',' == str[i]) || (';' == str[i]))
        return false;  /* Only single token68 is allowed */
      i++;
    }
    token68_len = i - token68_start;
    mhd_assert (0 != token68_len);

    /* Skip all whitespaces */
    while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
      i++;
    /* Check whether any garbage is present at the end of the string */
    if (str_len != i)
      return false;
    else
    {
      /* No more data in the string, only single token68. */
      pbauth->token68.str = str + token68_start;
      pbauth->token68.len = token68_len;
    }
  }
  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I listed every controlling expression (while and if conditions) present in the function so each can be inspected for possible invariant behavior under MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3. Other code fragments were not listed because they are not controlling expressions (variable declarations/assignments such as i = 0, token68_start/token68_len assignments, mhd_assert, pointer/length stores into pbauth, and simple return statements). Those non-control statements cannot violate the ‘‘controlling expressions shall not be invariant’’ rule and therefore do not require investigation for this specific rule.
